page.title: 19TIMOTHY HACKWORTH-2
page.content: He was contracted to provide and maintain the whole of the rolling stock and locomotives.At the Shildon Works he built locomotives for both the Railway Company and others at home and abroad,the first engine in Russia was built in Shildon.Engineers training was in great demand in Shildon.The first Shildon Engine Works built in 1825 consisted of a narrow barn like building of the Blacksmith's Shop,with a total of 20 workers.In 1827 when the 'Royal George' was built there were 50.It is on record that during the construction Hackworth was at work by the light of a candle in weather cold enough to freeze the tallow as it ran down the candle sides.One cannot help admiring the genius,perseverance and courage of Hackworth and his band of workers.In 1832 he opened his own Soho Works.
